title: Titan of terror: The dark imagination of H.P. Lovecraft - Silvia Moreno-Garc√≠a

multiple-choice.question: Who is the author credited with popularizing the modern horror story elements of "disturbing secrets in the family bloodline, and terrors so unspeakable the very thought of them might drive you mad"?

options.label: A
options.text: Edgar Allan Poe

options.label: B
options.text: Robert Chambers

options.label: C
options.text: Howard Phillips Lovecraft

options.label: D
options.text: Robert E. Howard

multiple-choice.question: What was the main challenge that Howard Phillips Lovecraft faced in creating a new kind of terror in his stories?

options.label: A
options.text: People had seen real horrors during World War I and were no longer frightened of fantastical folklore.

options.label: B
options.text: Lovecraft was struggling to find a new style that would appeal to readers.

options.label: C
options.text: Lovecraft's stories were too long and needed to be condensed.

options.label: D
options.text: Lovecraft was not a skilled writer and needed to improve his craft.

multiple-choice.question: What strange meteorite falls near a farmhouse in "The Colour out of Space", causing a nightmarish hellscape?

options.label: A
options.text: A meteorite with a strange color

options.label: B
options.text: A comet that brings destruction

options.label: C
options.text: A strange rock that mutates the farm

options.label: D
options.text: A meteorite that brings scientific methodology

multiple-choice.question: What is the source of horror in "Lovecraftian" horror?

options.label: A
options.text: Recognizable monsters and graphic violence

options.label: B
options.text: The unknown and the unseen, often left to the dark depths of our imagination.

options.label: C
options.text: The forces of nature

options.label: D
options.text: The supernatural

options.label: A
options.text: The Cthulhu Mythos

options.label: B
options.text: The Lovecraftian Universe

options.label: C
options.text: The Horror Universe

options.label: D
options.text: The Mythos Universe

options.label: B
options.text: Yog-Sothoth

options.label: C
options.text: Azathoth

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: Robert E. Howard

options.label: B
options.text: Robert Bloch

options.label: C
options.text: H.P. Lovecraft

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the Great Old One who froths as primal slime in nuclear chaos beyond the nethermost outposts of space and time?

options.label: A
options.text: Yog-Sothoth

options.label: B
options.text: Azathoth

options.label: C
options.text: Cthulhu

options.label: D
options.text: Shub-Niggurath

multiple-choice.question: What is the theme of Howard Phillips Lovecraft's stories, as mentioned in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The power of science and technology

options.label: B
options.text: The danger of the unknown and the unseen, as well as the cosmic indifference of the universe.

options.label: C
options.text: The importance of friendship and loyalty

options.label: D
options.text: The need for financial success

multiple-choice.question: What is the outcome of Howard Phillips Lovecraft's protagonists stumbling onto hints of the existence of the Great Old Ones?

options.label: A
options.text: They are able to defeat the monsters and save the day

options.label: B
options.text: They are driven insane by the knowledge, and if they survive, the reader is left with no feeling of triumph, only cosmic indifference.

options.label: C
options.text: They are able to uncover the secrets of the universe

options.label: D
options.text: They are able to find financial success

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the universe that Howard Phillips Lovecraft created, which includes a blend of mythological and scientific elements?

options.label: A
options.text: The Cthulhu Mythos

options.label: B
options.text: The Lovecraftian Universe

options.label: C
options.text: The Horror Universe

options.label: D
options.text: The Mythos Universe

multiple-choice.question: What is the main characteristic of the Great Old Ones in Lovecraft's stories?

options.label: A
options.text: They are powerful, yet benevolent beings

options.label: B
options.text: They are malevolent, yet pitiful beings

options.label: C
options.text: They are beyond human comprehension and are indifferent to human existence

options.label: D
options.text: They are mortal, yet powerful beings

multiple-choice.question: How did Howard Phillips Lovecraft's stories influence other authors, as mentioned in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: They encouraged them to write their own stories about historical events

options.label: B
options.text: They inspired them to create their own mythologies and universes

options.label: C
options.text: They influenced them to write their own stories about the supernatural

options.label: D
options.text: They inspired them to create their own characters and storylines

multiple-choice.question: What is the legacy of Howard Phillips Lovecraft's stories, according to the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: They have inspired numerous short stories, novels, tabletop games, and cultural icons

options.label: B
options.text: They have been widely criticized for their racist and sexist content

options.label: C
options.text: They have been largely forgotten and are no longer relevant

multiple-choice.question: What is the main characteristic of Howard Phillips Lovecraft's stories, as mentioned in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: They are primarily focused on the supernatural and the occult

options.label: B
options.text: They are primarily focused on the danger of the unknown and the unseen, as well as the cosmic indifference of the universe.

options.label: C
options.text: They are primarily focused on the power of science and technology

options.label: D
options.text: They are primarily focused on the importance of friendship and loyalty

title: The hidden network that makes the internet possible - Sajan Saini

multiple-choice.question: What was the maximum amount of data transmitted over a fifty-kilometer cable in a second by a team of Japanese and Danish researchers in 2012?

options.label: A
options.text: 10,000 hours of high-def video

options.label: B
options.text: 1 petabit

options.label: C
options.text: 10 petabits

options.label: D
options.text: 100 petabits

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between fiber optics and traditional electrical cables for long-distance communications?

options.label: A
options.text: Fiber optics use electricity, while traditional cables use light

options.label: B
options.text: Fiber optics use light, while traditional cables use electricity

options.label: C
options.text: Fiber optics are thicker, while traditional cables are thinner

options.label: D
options.text: Fiber optics are slower, while traditional cables are faster

options.label: A
options.text: Refraction

options.label: B
options.text: Diffraction

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Absorption
